title: Ephesians Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ephesians chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ephesians Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ephesians Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:1, how are believers urged to walk?
options: Worthy of the vocation wherewith they are called
In the vanity of their mind
questions.correctAnswer: Worthy of the vocation wherewith they are called
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:1 urges believers to walk worthy of the vocation wherewith they are called.

questions.question: What qualities does Ephesians 4:2 say believers should have towards one another?
options: Lowliness, meekness, longsuffering, forbearing in love
questions.correctAnswer: Lowliness, meekness, longsuffering, forbearing in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:2 describes these qualities as essential in how believers should treat each other.

questions.question: What is described as one in Ephesians 4:4?
questions.correctAnswer: One body and one Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:4 states there is one body and one Spirit.

questions.question: How many Lords, faiths, and baptisms does Ephesians 4:5 mention?
options: One Lord, one faith, one baptism
Two Lords, two faiths, two baptisms
Many Lords, many faiths, many baptisms
questions.correctAnswer: One Lord, one faith, one baptism
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:5 clearly states there is one Lord, one faith, and one baptism.

questions.question: Who is described in Ephesians 4:6 as 'above all, and through all, and in you all'?
questions.correctAnswer: God and Father of all
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:6 describes God and Father of all as being above all, through all, and in all.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:7, what is given to every one of us?
options: Grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:7 states grace is given to each one according to Christ's gift.

questions.question: What gifts did Christ give according to Ephesians 4:11?
options: Apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers
questions.correctAnswer: Apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:11 lists these specific roles as gifts given by Christ.

questions.question: What is the purpose of these gifts according to Ephesians 4:12?
options: For perfecting the saints, work of ministry, and edifying the body of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: For perfecting the saints, work of ministry, and edifying the body of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:12 explains the purpose of the gifts given to the church.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:14, why should believers no longer be children?
options: So they will not be tossed to and fro by every wind of doctrine
Because children are not allowed in the church
questions.correctAnswer: So they will not be tossed to and fro by every wind of doctrine
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:14 warns believers not to be unstable like children carried by false teachings.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 4:16 say is the result of the body being fitly joined and compacted?
options: Increase of the body unto the edifying of itself in love
questions.correctAnswer: Increase of the body unto the edifying of itself in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:16 describes the growth and building up of the body through unity.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 4:17 commands believers to walk as the Gentiles do, in the vanity of their mind.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:17 says not to walk as the Gentiles do in the vanity of their mind.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 4:22, believers should put off the old man, which is corrupt according to deceitful lusts.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:22 instructs believers to put off the corrupt old man.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 4:26 instructs believers to be angry and sin as much as they want before the sun goes down.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:26 says to be angry but not sin, and not to let the sun go down on wrath.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ephesians 4:25: 'Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man ______ with his neighbour.'
questions.correctAnswer: truth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:25 commands to speak truth with one's neighbour after putting away lying.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:32, how should believers treat one another?
questions.correctAnswer: Kind, tenderhearted, forgiving
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:32 instructs believers to be kind, tenderhearted and forgiving as God forgave them.

medium.title: Ephesians Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ephesians Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with bitterness and anger. Based on Ephesians 4, what biblical virtue would you encourage them to practice?
questions.correctAnswer: Kindness and forgiveness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:31-32 instructs believers to put away bitterness, wrath, anger, clamour, and evil speaking, and to be kind, tenderhearted, and forgiving one another as God forgave us. This teaches the importance of kindness and forgiveness in dealing with anger and bitterness.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 4 teach us about humility in our relationships with others?
options: By urging us to be humble, meek, and long-suffering, bearing with one another in love
By encouraging us to assert our opinions aggressively
By telling us to seek honor above others
By advising us to avoid all conflicts at any cost
questions.correctAnswer: By urging us to be humble, meek, and long-suffering, bearing with one another in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:2 calls believers to walk with lowliness, meekness, longsuffering, and to bear with one another in love. This reflects the biblical virtue of humility in relationships.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the different roles such as apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers given by Christ according to Ephesians 4?
options: For the perfecting of the saints, the work of ministry, and the edifying of the body of Christ
To create division in the church
questions.correctAnswer: For the perfecting of the saints, the work of ministry, and the edifying of the body of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:11-12 explains that Christ gave these roles to equip the saints, build up the church, and enable ministry, emphasizing service and spiritual growth.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to lie to gain advantage. What does Ephesians 4 counsel about honesty?
options: Put away lying and speak truth with your neighbor
Lie occasionally if it benefits you
questions.correctAnswer: Put away lying and speak truth with your neighbor
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:25 instructs believers to put away lying and to speak truthfully because we are members of one another, highlighting the importance of honesty and integrity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4, what attitude should believers have towards anger?
options: Be angry but do not sin, and do not let the sun go down on your wrath
questions.correctAnswer: Be angry but do not sin, and do not let the sun go down on your wrath
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:26 teaches that it is natural to be angry but warns against sinning in anger and encourages resolving anger quickly.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 4 say about how believers should grow in their faith?
options: By speaking the truth in love and growing up into Christ, the head
By following every new teaching without discernment
questions.correctAnswer: By speaking the truth in love and growing up into Christ, the head
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:15 emphasizes that believers should grow spiritually by speaking truth in love and becoming more like Christ, who is the head of the body.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ephesians 4 teaches that believers should put on the new man, which is created in ______ and true holiness.
questions.correctAnswer: righteousness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:24 states that the new man is created after God in righteousness and true holiness, highlighting the moral transformation expected of believers.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 4 teaches that believers should be tossed to and fro by every new teaching and cunning craftiness.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:14 warns believers not to be children, tossed to and fro by every wind of doctrine and cunning craftiness, but to be grounded in faith and knowledge of Christ.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 4 instruct believers to handle their speech?
options: Speak only what builds up and ministers grace to the hearers
Speak freely without concern for others
questions.correctAnswer: Speak only what builds up and ministers grace to the hearers
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:29 commands believers to let no corrupt communication come from their mouths, but only what is good for edification and grace to the hearers.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4, what is the Christian’s response to past sinful behavior?
options: Put off the old man, be renewed in the spirit of the mind, and put on the new man
Continue the same behavior without change
Ignore sin and hope it improves
questions.correctAnswer: Put off the old man, be renewed in the spirit of the mind, and put on the new man
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:22-24 instructs believers to put off their former sinful conduct, be renewed in their mind, and embrace the new self created in righteousness and holiness.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 4 teach about work ethic and generosity?
options: Those who stole should steal no more but work honestly to have something to share with those in need
It is acceptable to steal if one is in need
Avoid work to focus on spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: Those who stole should steal no more but work honestly to have something to share with those in need
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:28 emphasizes honest labor as the way to provide for oneself and to have the ability to give to those in need, promoting integrity and generosity.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 4 says believers should grieve the Holy Spirit by disobedience.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:30 instructs believers not to grieve the Holy Spirit by disobedience, as the Spirit seals us for the day of redemption.

questions.question: How should believers maintain unity according to Ephesians 4?
options: Endeavour to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace
Ignore conflicts and hope they disappear
Separate into groups based on opinions
questions.correctAnswer: Endeavour to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:3 urges believers to make every effort to preserve the unity of the Spirit through peace, emphasizing harmony within the church.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 4 say about the mindset of unbelievers compared to believers?
options: Unbelievers walk in the vanity of their mind with understanding darkened, while believers are renewed in the spirit of their mind
Believers should adopt the vain thinking of unbelievers
There is no difference between their mindsets
questions.correctAnswer: Unbelievers walk in the vanity of their mind with understanding darkened, while believers are renewed in the spirit of their mind
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:17-18 contrasts the darkened understanding and alienation from God of unbelievers with the renewal of the mind that believers experience (Eph 4:23).

questions.question: How does Ephesians 4 describe the body of Christ and its growth?
options: The body fitly joined together grows by the working of each part, building itself up in love
The body grows through competition and division
Growth depends on individual efforts only
The body is static and does not grow
questions.correctAnswer: The body fitly joined together grows by the working of each part, building itself up in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:16 describes the church as a body joined and held together by Christ, growing through the effective working of every part for edification in love.

hard.title: Ephesians Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ephesians Chapter 4.

questions.question: In Ephesians 4:11, which roles are given by Christ to equip the saints for ministry?
options: apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors and teachers
questions.correctAnswer: apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors and teachers
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:11 explicitly lists apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors and teachers as the gifts given by Christ for the perfecting of the saints.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:4-6, which of the following statements reflects the unity described in the passage?
options: There is one body, one Spirit, one Lord, one faith, one baptism, one God and Father of all
There are many bodies, many spirits, many lords, and many baptisms
There is one body but many spirits and many gods
There are many faiths, but only one baptism and one God
questions.correctAnswer: There is one body, one Spirit, one Lord, one faith, one baptism, one God and Father of all
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:4-6 emphasizes the unity in the Christian faith by declaring one body, one Spirit, one Lord, one faith, one baptism, and one God and Father.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'he led captivity captive' in Ephesians 4:8 in its Old Testament context?
options: It alludes to Psalm 68:18, where the victorious king ascends, taking captives as spoils
It refers to the Exodus from Egypt as a form of captivity
It describes the captivity of Israel in Babylon
It references the conquest of Jericho by Joshua
questions.correctAnswer: It alludes to Psalm 68:18, where the victorious king ascends, taking captives as spoils
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:8 quotes Psalm 68:18, applying the imagery of the victorious king ascending with captives to Christ's ascension and gifts given to men.

questions.question: Which literary device is prominently used in Ephesians 4:9-10 to describe Christ’s descent and ascent?
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:9-10 uses chiasm by presenting descending first and then ascending far above all heavens, creating a mirrored structure emphasizing Christ's movement.

questions.question: In Ephesians 4:15, the phrase 'speaking the truth in love' best exemplifies which Greek word pair concept?
questions.correctAnswer: aletheia (truth) and agape (love)
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:15 combines 'truth' (aletheia) and 'love' (agape), highlighting the Christian imperative to communicate truth with unconditional love.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 4:16 describe the growth and unity of the body of Christ?
options: Joined and knit together by every joint supplying, growing with the increase of God
Joined and knit together by every joint supplying, growing with the increase of the body, edifying itself in love
Separated by differences but united by faith
Growing independently without need for joints
questions.correctAnswer: Joined and knit together by every joint supplying, growing with the increase of the body, edifying itself in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:16 explains the body's growth through every part working effectively, building itself up in love, reflecting organic unity.

questions.question: Ephesians 4:17-19 contrasts the behavior of Gentiles with believers. What is the main reason given for Gentiles' alienation from God?
options: Because of ignorance and the blindness of their heart
Because of their wealth and pride
Because of the law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Because of ignorance and the blindness of their heart
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:18 states that Gentiles have understanding darkened and are alienated due to ignorance and the blindness of their heart.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ephesians 4:22-24, believers are instructed to put off the old man which is corrupt according to deceitful lusts, and to be renewed in the spirit of the mind, and put on the new man, which is created in righteousness and ________.
questions.correctAnswer: true holiness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:24 specifically states the new man is created in righteousness and true holiness.

questions.question: What is the command given in Ephesians 4:25 regarding communication among believers?
options: Putting away lying, speak truth each one with his neighbor
Speak in parables to confuse outsiders
questions.correctAnswer: Putting away lying, speak truth each one with his neighbor
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:25 commands believers to put away lying and speak the truth with their neighbors because they are members of one another.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 4:26 caution about anger?
options: Be angry but sin not; do not let the sun go down on your wrath
Use anger as a tool to control others
questions.correctAnswer: Be angry but sin not; do not let the sun go down on your wrath
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:26 teaches that anger itself is not sin, but believers should not allow anger to lead to sin or linger unresolved.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 4:27 encourages believers to give place to the devil in their hearts.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:27 specifically commands not to give place to the devil, highlighting spiritual vigilance.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:28, what is the recommended behavior for one who previously stole?
options: Let him steal no more but labor, working with his hands so he may have to give to those in need
Avoid work and depend on charity
questions.correctAnswer: Let him steal no more but labor, working with his hands so he may have to give to those in need
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:28 instructs former thieves to stop stealing and instead labor honestly to provide for themselves and others.

questions.question: What kind of speech does Ephesians 4:29 command believers to use?
options: No corrupt communication, but that which is good for edifying and ministering grace
questions.correctAnswer: No corrupt communication, but that which is good for edifying and ministering grace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:29 warns against corrupt speech and encourages words that build up others and convey grace.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 4:30 describe the relationship between believers and the Holy Spirit?
options: Do not grieve the Holy Spirit, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption
questions.correctAnswer: Do not grieve the Holy Spirit, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:30 exhorts believers not to grieve the Holy Spirit, who has sealed them as a guarantee of their future redemption.

questions.question: What is the final exhortation in Ephesians 4:32 regarding interpersonal relationships?
options: Be kind, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you
Ignore offenses and do not forgive
questions.correctAnswer: Be kind, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:32 calls believers to kindness, compassion, and forgiveness modeled on God's forgiveness in Christ.

theological.title: Ephesians Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ephesians Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:1, how are believers exhorted to live in relation to their calling?
options: Walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called
questions.correctAnswer: Walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:1 urges believers to conduct themselves in a manner worthy of their divine calling, reflecting a life of holiness and commitment. This is consistent with passages such as Colossians 1:10, 1 Thessalonians 2:12, Romans 12:1-2, and 1 Peter 1:15-16, which also exhort believers to live transformed lives honoring God.

questions.question: Which qualities does Ephesians 4:2 list as necessary for maintaining unity among believers?
options: Lowliness, meekness, longsuffering, forbearing one another in love
questions.correctAnswer: Lowliness, meekness, longsuffering, forbearing one another in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:2 highlights humility (lowliness), gentleness (meekness), patience (longsuffering), and love as the foundation for unity, mirroring teachings in Philippians 2:3-4, Colossians 3:12, Galatians 5:22-23, and 1 Corinthians 13:4-7 about Christian character fostering harmony.

questions.question: What is the 'one hope' to which believers are called, as stated in Ephesians 4:4?
questions.correctAnswer: One hope of your calling
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:4 emphasizes the unity of believers in sharing one hope associated with their calling in Christ. This theme of one hope is also seen in Titus 2:13, Colossians 1:27, Hebrews 6:18, and Romans 8:24-25, which affirm the eschatological hope believers possess in Christ's return and eternal life.

questions.question: Ephesians 4:5 mentions several 'ones.' Which of the following is NOT listed among them?
questions.correctAnswer: One church
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:5 lists 'one Lord, one faith, one baptism,' but does not mention 'one church' in this verse. The emphasis is on the unity of foundational Christian truths, also seen in Deuteronomy 6:4, John 17:21, 1 Corinthians 12:13, and Galatians 3:27, which stress unity in God, faith, and the Spirit rather than institutional structures.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:6, what is the nature of God the Father in relation to all?
options: Who is above all, and through all, and in you all
Who is confined to heaven alone
questions.correctAnswer: Who is above all, and through all, and in you all
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:6 depicts God as sovereign and omnipresent, transcending all and dwelling within believers. This aligns with Psalms 139:7-12, Jeremiah 23:24, Colossians 1:17, and Acts 17:28, which testify to God's all-encompassing presence and authority.

questions.question: What gifts are given to believers according to Ephesians 4:7-8?
options: Grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ, who led captivity captive and gave gifts to men
questions.correctAnswer: Grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ, who led captivity captive and gave gifts to men
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:7-8 describes spiritual gifts as grace given by Christ after His ascension, symbolizing His victory over captivity. Similar teaching on spiritual gifts and Christ's triumph appears in Romans 12:6-8, 1 Corinthians 12:4-11, Psalm 68:18, and Acts 2:33.

questions.question: Who are the five groups of gifted servants Christ gave to the church as listed in Ephesians 4:11?
options: Apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers
Kings, priests, judges, scribes, and elders
Philosophers, poets, historians, prophets, and teachers
Disciples, martyrs, deacons, bishops, and elders
questions.correctAnswer: Apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:11 explicitly names these five roles given by Christ to equip the church. This distribution of roles is also reflected in Acts 2:42, Romans 12:6-8, 1 Corinthians 12:28, and 1 Timothy 3:1-13, which discuss spiritual leadership and ministry gifts.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of these gifted ministers according to Ephesians 4:12?
options: For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:12 states that gifted leaders are given to equip believers for maturity and service, building up the church. This aligns with 2 Timothy 3:16-17, 1 Corinthians 14:12, Colossians 1:28, and Hebrews 10:24-25, which emphasize edification and spiritual growth.

questions.question: What is described in Ephesians 4:13 as the goal of Christian maturity?
options: Unity of the faith and knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Unity of the faith and knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:13 presents Christian maturity as growing into full unity in faith and knowledge of Christ, reflecting His fullness. This concept is supported by Philippians 3:12-15, Colossians 2:9-10, Hebrews 6:1, and 2 Peter 1:5-8, which call believers to grow into Christlikeness.

questions.question: What is the warning given in Ephesians 4:14 about spiritual immaturity?
options: Being tossed to and fro, carried about with every wind of doctrine by the sleight of men
questions.correctAnswer: Being tossed to and fro, carried about with every wind of doctrine by the sleight of men
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:14 warns against spiritual instability and susceptibility to false teachings, emphasizing the need for maturity. Similar warnings appear in 2 Timothy 3:13, Hebrews 5:12-14, Jude 1:12-13, and Matthew 7:15-16 about discernment and steadfastness.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:15, how should believers grow in their faith?
options: By speaking the truth in love, growing up into Christ who is the head
By isolating themselves from the world
By strict adherence to legalistic rules
questions.correctAnswer: By speaking the truth in love, growing up into Christ who is the head
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:15 stresses the importance of truth tempered with love as the means to spiritual growth into Christ’s likeness, who is the head of the church. This principle is echoed in Colossians 3:16, 1 Corinthians 13, John 13:34-35, and Galatians 5:22-23.

questions.question: Ephesians 4:16 describes the church as a body. What is the key element for its growth and edification?
options: Every joint supplying and effectual working in the measure of every part
questions.correctAnswer: Every joint supplying and effectual working in the measure of every part
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:16 teaches that the church grows and is built up when every member functions properly and contributes. This metaphor is consistent with 1 Corinthians 12:12-27, Romans 12:4-8, Colossians 2:19, and Hebrews 10:24-25.

questions.question: What contrast does Paul make in Ephesians 4:17-19 between the Gentile way of life and the Christian life?
options: Gentiles walk in vanity of mind, darkened understanding, alienated from God, past feeling, given to uncleanness
Gentiles are more righteous and holy than Christians
Gentiles have superior wisdom and knowledge
Gentiles live according to God's law perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: Gentiles walk in vanity of mind, darkened understanding, alienated from God, past feeling, given to uncleanness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:17-19 describes the Gentile life as spiritually blind and morally corrupt, contrasting with the renewed life in Christ. This contrast is echoed in Romans 1:21-32, Colossians 3:5-10, 1 Corinthians 6:9-11, and Titus 3:3.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 4:22-24 instruct believers to do regarding their former way of life?
options: Put off the old man, be renewed in the spirit of your mind, and put on the new man created after God
Continue in the old ways until fully convinced
Ignore any change to the heart
Focus on external religious observances only
questions.correctAnswer: Put off the old man, be renewed in the spirit of your mind, and put on the new man created after God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:22-24 calls for a decisive break from former sinful behaviors and a renewal of the mind to live a righteous life modeled after God's holiness. This teaching parallels Romans 6:6-7, Colossians 3:9-10, 2 Corinthians 5:17, and Titus 3:5.

questions.question: What practical ethical instruction does Ephesians 4:25 give to believers in relation to others?
options: Put away lying and speak truth to your neighbor, for we are members one of another
questions.correctAnswer: Put away lying and speak truth to your neighbor, for we are members one of another
questions.explanation: Ephesians 4:25 emphasizes honesty and transparency among believers as members of one body, reflecting biblical principles also found in Proverbs 12:22, Colossians 3:9, John 8:32, and Zechariah 8:16.
